intro: Oenothera rhizocarpa, commonly known as the rootstalk evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in arid and sandy soils. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Oenothera rhizocarpa is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species known for their medicinal and ornamental value.
